summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Baby's Day Out Review Date: 2014/10/31 Categories: Comedy, Drama, Cheerful, Outlandish Product Description: ['Nine-month-old Baby Bink proves to be more than a match for a trio of bumbling kidnappers, escaping and leading the criminal crew on a hilarious slapstick chase!'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Patrick Read Johnson'], 'Producers': ['John Hughes', 'Richard Vane'], 'Starring': ['Joe Mantegna', 'Lara Flynn Boyle', 'Joe Pantoliano']} Review Text: I have seen this movie a dozen times and I still laugh out loud! Joe Mantegna is hilarious!

Mrs. Hambone Review Title: I'm still laughing! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/04/03 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Noel Buckner', 'Rob Whittlesey'], 'Producers': ['Rob Whittlesey', 'Zvi Dor-Ner', 'Beth Harrington', 'Michael Milker'], 'Starring': ['John Aaron', 'Fred Haise']} Review Text: The sound was pretty bad.
Mrs H Review Title: Three Stars Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/11/05 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Francis Lawrence'], 'Producers': ['Suzanne Collins', 'Joseph Drake', 'Nina Jacobson', 'Jon Kilik', 'Darlien Morales', "Aldric La'auli Porter", 'Louise Rosner', 'Allison Shearmur', 'Bryan Unkeless'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Lawrence'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']} Review Text: It was OK. Not as spectacular as the other ones.
Mrs Hambone Review Title: OK. glad I didn't pay for it. Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/06/30 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Roberto Benigni'], 'Producers': ['Gianluigi Braschi', 'Elda Ferri'], 'Starring': ['Roberto Benigni', 'Nicoletta Braschi']} Review Text: I've watched this movie at least a dozen time. Don't let the subtitles deter you. It's a wonderful story about love. I told a friend yesterday that it makes me laugh til I cry and then cry because I can't laugh. I know I'll watch it again. Review Title: This is my favorite movie. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/06/30 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Israel Horovitz'], 'Producers': ['Rachael Horovitz', 'Gary Foster', 'Nitsa Benchetrit', 'David C. Barrot'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Kline', 'Kristin Scott Thomas', 'Maggie Smith'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']} Review Text: I found a cure for my life-long insomnia. Review Title: Snooze fest. Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/07/16 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Roger Michell'], 'Producers': ['Richard Hack', 'Michael Viner', 'Jerry Leider'], 'Starring': ['Christopher Reeve', 'Deborah Raffin', 'Lloyd Bochner'], 'Studio': ['Comedy']} Review Text: Turned it off soon as the gratuitous sex started which was pretty much after the titles. Review Title: Turned it off Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Where the Red Fern Grows Review Date: 2017/07/16 Categories: Drama, Kids, Charming, Thrilling Product Description: ['A boy’s yearning for two Redbone Hound dogs, which his parents can’t afford during the desolate times of the Depression in the Ozarks, is the setting for this truly triumphant film.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jim McCullough Jr.', 'Norman Tokar'], 'Producers': ['Lyman Dayton'], 'Starring': ['James Whitmore', 'Beverly Garland', 'Jack Ging']} Review Text: Nice movie although predictable. Some bullying, violence and deals with death so I'd give this a PG rating meaning parents should watch this before deciding to let the kids watch it. Review Title: I'd give this a PG rating Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/07/16 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Donald Shebib'], 'Producers': ['Philip D. Fehrle', 'James Margellos', 'Noel Resnick', 'Hal Roach'], 'Starring': ['Charlton Heston', 'Bruce Greenwood', 'Patricia Gage']} Review Text: This is a wonderful movie for family viewing. A lesson in love, forgiveness and tolerance. Some anger and hardheartedness so I'd rate this PG rather than P. But then, I rate everything at least a PG because I think parents should always supervise what the kids are watching. The child actors were brilliant as well as adorable. Charlton Heston is perfect as always. Review Title: This is a wonderful movie for family viewing Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a distinct preference for comedic and family-oriented films, often appreciating content that combines humor with emotional depth. Recurrent 4 to 5-star ratings indicate a strong positive sentiment towards films that elicit laughter and heartfelt moments. 

They gravitate towards materials that are either light-hearted or provide profound messaging, as seen in multiple reviews highlighting emotional themes, particularly in family settings. The user is sensitive to the quality of audio and overall production, noting issues like poor sound or gratuitous content, which influences their ratings negatively. This suggests a preference for well-produced movies with engaging storytelling.

Price sensitivity is less clearly defined but suggests a willingness to invest in films that deliver genuine enjoyment, contrasting with negative experiences leading to low ratings when expectations are not met. Furthermore, there is a clear inclination towards reviewing movies for their appropriateness for children, exhibiting a parental consideration in their choices.

In summary, the individual prefers humorous, touching, and family-friendly films, values high production quality, and demonstrates a parental mindset regarding content suitability, ultimately seeking enjoyment and meaningful connections through their viewing experiences.

target_interaction.title: Terrific!
target_interaction.text: The fact is I loved this movie a great deal. I can't really explain it other than to say it creates a magical feeling in me almost more than any other movie. I love it all. It is funny as all get out. It is  one of Lee Marvin's best performances ever. Clint Eastwood does a fine job. The side characters are great and again very funny. My aunt took me to see this movie when I was 18 years old and I laughed my self sick. There is nothing quite like this movie anywhere else and I would highly recommend it. If you love it as much as I do you will never regret seeing it and you will want to see it again and again.
